prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following transformation: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.595, 0.0] 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw the first face (face_1) with a single loop (loop_1), which consists of the following lines: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.3549, 0.0] - line_2: [0.3549, 0.0] to [0.3549, 0.2533] - line_3: [0.3549, 0.2533] to [0.0, 0.2533] - line_4: [0.0, 0.2533] to [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3549. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system information. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch along its normal with an extrusion depth of 0.595, creating a 0.3549 units high, 0.3549 units wide three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2 Instructions Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, showing a section of the first part. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the same transformation as Part 1. 2. Create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw face_1 identical to Part 1. 4. Draw face_2 with a single loop (loop_1), which consists of the following lines: - line_1: [0.0, 0.2533] to [0.3549, 0.2533] - line_2: [0.3549, 0.2533] to [0.3549, 0.0] - line_3: [0.3549, 0.0] to [0.7289, 0.0] - line_4: [0.7289, 0.0] to [0.7289, 0.4804] - line_5: [0.7289, 0.4804] to [0.0, 0.4804] - line_6: [0.0, 0.4804] to [0.0, 0.2533] 5. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.7289. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system information. 7. Execute a join operation by extruding faces 1 and 2 by 0.0775 units along the normal and 0.0775 units opposite the normal, creating a 0.155 units high, 0.7289 units wide, and 0.7289 units deep three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, showcasing a section of the first part.</description>

Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0, 0, 0] and translation vector [0, 0, 0.0055]. 3. **Extrusion:** Extrude the scaled and transformed 3D sketch along the normal vector by 0.0055 units, resulting in a solid body NewBodyFeatureOperation. **Dimensions** - Height: 0.0055 units - Width: 0.75 units - Length: 0.75 units By following these instructions, you will successfully create the first intermediate CAD part. prompt: <description>**Final Shape Description** The final shape is a cylindrical object with a central hole, similar to a washer or a ring. It has a smooth, curved surface and is symmetrical along its central axis. The inner diameter of the ring is approximately half of its outer diameter. **Part 1 Instructions** Construct a ring-shaped object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.1599. * Face 1, Loop 1: 1. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.0305 towards and opposite the normal. This will create a hollow ring shape. **Part 2 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0381, 0.0381, 0.1599. * Face 1, Loop 1: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.3369, 0.3369) with a radius of 0.3369. * Face 1, Loop 2: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.3369, 0.3369) with a radius of 0.0952. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6739. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.0114 towards and opposite the normal. This will create a cylindrical object with a central hole. **Part 3 Instructions** Construct a stepped cylindrical object with a central hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.2798, 0.2798, 0.1599. * Face 1, Loop 1: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.0952, 0.0952) with a radius of 0.0952. * Face 1, Loop 2: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.0952, 0.0952) with a radius of 0.0476. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1904. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.0609 towards the normal and 0 towards the opposite direction. This will create a stepped cylindrical object with a central hole. **Part 4 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector 0.356, 0.375, 0.0266. * Face 1, Loop 1: 1. Draw a circle centered at (0.019, 0.019) with a radius of 0.019. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0381. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch to a depth of 0.1904 in the opposite direction of the normal. This will create a cylindrical object with a tapered end. Once all the parts are created, combine them in the following sequence: part 1, part 2, part 3, and finally part 4 to form the final shape. This sequence is important to ensure the correct assembly of the parts and achieve the desired final shape.</description>
